remarks: Zero times a vector is the zero vector.  Equation 1a of [Kreyszig] p. 51.  (Contributed by NM, 4-Nov-2006.)  (New usage is discouraged.)
statement:
vc0.1 $e |- G = ( 1st ` W ) $.
vc0.2 $e |- S = ( 2nd ` W ) $.
vc0.3 $e |- X = ran G $.
vc0.4 $e |- Z = ( GId ` G ) $.
vc0 $p |- ( ( W e. CVecOLD /\ A e. X ) -> ( 0 S A ) = Z ) $.
